snippet: The nation had fewer exports largely because of the global slowdown.
abstract: Commerce Department reports that the United States trade deficit grew to $42 billion in July, widened by fewer exports to Europe, India and Brazil that offset a steep decline in oil imports; increase of 0.2 percent is from June's deficit of $41.9 billion; American exports fell 1 percent, to $183.3 billion; sales of autos, telecommunications equipment and heavy machinery all declined. Imports dropped 0.8 percent, to $225.3 billion.
lead_paragraph: The nation had fewer exports largely because of the global slowdown.

headline.seo: U.S. Trade Deficit Grew Slightly in July
headline.main: Trade Deficit Grew Slightly as Exports Fell in July
headline.print_headline: Trade Deficit Grew Slightly As Exports Fell in July
